newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka cracks down on video parlours, gambling.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka cracks down on video parlours, gambling.

text.p: Sri Lanka has issued emergency orders cracking down on illegal video parlours which it said offended public morality and corrupted schoolchildren.
A government statement on Wednesday said the government had increased penalties against video parlours which showed pornographic films.
And anyone found running one was liable to a fine of 100,000 rupees ($1,750) or a jail term of between two and 10 years, or both.
Until now, running a video parlour without a licence carried a fine of up to 1,000 rupees and a jail term of no more than six months.
"These video parlours have become notorious for pornographic films which tend to attract not only the adolescents but at times even schoolchildren," the statement said.
It said the government had also decided to close down illegal gambling centres.
Police had already arrested 130 people and closed down 25 video parlours and 79 gambling centres in and around Colombo under the new rules, the statement said.
